snippet: No matter how many times a golfer visualizes closing out a PGA Tour victory or how thoroughly he prepares for it, there is no way of knowing how he will react until he is in the situation.
abstract: Professional golfers describe how they deal with final-round stress of attempting to close out a PGA Tour victory; many turn to exercise routines, yoga and meditation to try to ease the jitters that come with adrenaline.
lead_paragraph: No matter how many times a golfer visualizes closing out a PGA Tour victory or how thoroughly he prepares for it, there is no way of knowing how he will react until he is in the situation.

headline.seo: P.G.A. Golfers Seek Ways to Tame Final-Round Stress
